critique: The document is an executive order issued by President George W. Bush concerning the situation in Iraq in 2003. It expands the scope of a national emergency to address obstacles to the reconstruction of Iraq and authorizes the confiscation of property from the former Iraqi regime and related individuals/entities. The confiscated property is intended to be transferred to the Development Fund for Iraq for humanitarian and reconstruction purposes. The order also prohibits transactions that evade the prohibitions set forth in the order and donations to sanctioned individuals. It grants broad authority to the Secretary of the Treasury to implement the order.
